title: Jarvis Inc Skill Definition
description: JSON Schema for defining skills in the Jarvis Inc Skills Repository. Skills represent capabilities that can be assigned to AI agents.

title.description: Human-readable skill title displayed in the UI

description.description: Brief description of what the skill does

category.description: Skill category for grouping in the UI

icon.description: Lucide React icon name (e.g. 'Mail', 'Globe', 'Code'). Must be a valid Lucide icon identifier.

tags.description: Array of lowercase kebab-case tags for search and filtering

status.description: Current availability status of the skill

connection_type.description: How the skill connects to its underlying service. 'llm' = uses an AI model, 'oauth' = OAuth 2.0 flow, 'api_key' = API key authentication, 'cli' = command-line tool, 'none' = no external connection

models.description: Available LLM models for this skill. Required when connection_type is 'llm', null otherwise.

default_model.description: Default model to use. Required when connection_type is 'llm', null otherwise.

fixed_service.description: Name of the fixed external service (e.g. 'Google', 'Slack', 'OpenAI'). Used when service_type is 'fixed'.

service_type.description: 'fixed' = hardcoded to one service, 'configurable' = user can choose provider, null = not applicable

oauth_config.description: OAuth 2.0 configuration. Required when connection_type is 'oauth'.

pkce.description: Whether to use PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) in the OAuth flow

curl_example.description: Example cURL command demonstrating the underlying API call. Useful for api_key connection types.

cli_config.description: CLI tool configuration. Required when connection_type is 'cli'.

install_command.description: Command to install the CLI tool

api_config.description: API configuration for api_key connection types. Describes the external API endpoint.

auth_header.description: Header name for the API key (e.g. 'Authorization', 'X-API-Key')

vault_service.description: Vault service name to look up the API key (e.g. 'openai', 'stability')

api_model.description: Model ID to use in API calls (e.g. 'dall-e-3', 'gemini-2.5-flash-image'). This is the source of truth â€” executors must read from here, never hardcode.

headers.description: Custom HTTP headers to include in every request (e.g. { "Accept": "text/markdown" }). Merged with auth headers. Skill-defined headers take precedence over defaults.

output_type.description: Primary output type of this skill. Determines how results are rendered in chat, collateral, and test dialogs. 'image' = base64/URL images, 'audio' = audio files, 'data' = structured JSON, 'mixed' = multiple types.

collateral.description: Whether skill execution results should be automatically saved to the Collateral page as artifacts.

execution_handler.description: Named execution handler function in skillExecutor.ts. Required for api_key skills that call external APIs directly (e.g. 'openai_image_generation', 'gemini_image_generation'). When set, the executor dispatches to this handler instead of the LLM path.

risk_level.description: Risk classification for skill enablement. 'safe' = normal approval flow. 'moderate' = yellow warning banner on approval card. 'dangerous' = red warning + type-to-confirm gate before enabling. CLI skills default to 'moderate', bash/shell/sudo skills should be 'dangerous'.

pricing.description: Cost model for this skill's API usage

commands.description: Array of command definitions that this skill exposes

parameters.description: Array of parameter definitions for this command

default.description: Default value if parameter is optional

media_type.description: MIME type of the returned content (e.g. 'image/png', 'audio/mp3', 'application/json'). Used by UI to render results correctly.

system_prompt.description: System prompt for LLM execution. Overrides the default generic system prompt. Supports {param} interpolation.

prompt_template.description: User message template for LLM execution. Supports {param} interpolation from command parameters.

request.description: Declarative HTTP request config. When present, the generic executor handles this command instead of a hardcoded handler.

path.description: Appended to api_config.base_url. Supports {param_name} interpolation. Special: {api_model}, {api_key}.

headers.description: Additional HTTP headers for this command

body.description: JSON body template. String values with {param} get interpolated. Null for GET.

response.description: How to parse the API response.

passthrough.description: Skip extraction, return raw response as-is

passthrough_to_llm.description: Send raw response to LLM for formatting (requires passthrough:true)

extract.description: Named fields to extract via dot-path (e.g. 'current_condition[0].temp_F')

extract_raw.description: Single dot-path for the entire result (e.g. binary data)

error_path.description: Dot-path to check for API error message

output_template.description: Markdown template with {field} placeholders from response.extract
